dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 4248 IH: Veterans Education Outcomes Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Takano (for himself and Mr. Flores) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To require institutions of higher education to disseminate information with respect to the completion rates, employment rates, and retention rates of recipients of GI Bill funding.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Veterans Education Outcomes Act.

section.header: Information dissemination with respect to recipients of GI Bill funding
section.text: Section 485(a) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1092) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in clause (iii), by striking and; and
by adding and at the end of clause (iv); and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: are recipients of educational assistance provided under chapter 30 or 33 of title 38, United States Code, or chapter 1606 of title 10, United States Code;

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

The information disseminated under subparagraphs (E), (L), (R), (S), and (U) of paragraph (1) shall be disaggregated by the recipients of educational assistance provided under chapter 30 or 33 of title 38, United States Code, or chapter 1606 of title 10, United States Code, if the number of students in such subgroup is sufficient to yield statistically reliable information and reporting will not reveal personally identifiable information about an individual student. If such number is not sufficient for such purposes, then the institution shall note that the institution enrolled too few of such students to so disclose or report with confidence and confidentiality.
